questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Elements?
correct: Pure substances that cannot be broken down into 2 or more simpler substances by any processes

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Compounds?
correct: A pure substance that contains 2 or more different elements that are chemically combined in a fixed ratio

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Mixtures?
correct: Made of 2 or more substances that are not chemically combined

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Atom?
correct: The smallest particle of an element that has the chemical properties of that element

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Isotopes?
correct: Atoms of the same element with the same number of protons but a different number of neutrons

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Molecule?
correct: A group of 2 or more atoms chemically combined

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Ion?
correct: A charged particle formed when an atom or a group of atoms by the loss or gain of electrons

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Covalent Bond?
correct: The bond formed by the sharing of electrons between 2 atoms

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Relative Atomic Mass?
correct: The average mas of an element when compared with 1/12 of the mass of a carbon-12 atom

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Relative Molecular Mass?
correct: The average mass of a molecule of a substance when compared with 1/12 of the mass of a carbon-12 atom

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are A mole of a substance?
correct: The same number of particles as the number of toms in 12g of carbon-12

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Molar mass?
correct: The mass of 1 mole of any substance

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Molar Gas Volume?
correct: One mole of any gas occupies 24dm3 at room temperature and pressure

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Concentration?
correct: The amount of solute dissolved in a given amount of solution

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Empirical Formula?
correct: The simplest formula of a compound which shows the type of elements present in the compound and the simplest ratio of the different types of atoms in the compound

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Molecular Formula?
correct: The formula that shows the exact number if atoms of each element in a molecule

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Hydrocarbons?
correct: Organic compounds with only carbon and hydrogen atoms

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Saturated?
correct: There are 4 different atoms bonded to each carbon atom

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Polyunsaturated?
correct: Contains more than 1 Carbon-Carbon Double Bond in their molecules

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Isomers?
correct: Compounds that have the same molecular formula but different structural formula

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Macromolecule?
correct: Any long chain molecule that contains hundreds or thousands of atoms, joined together by covalent bonds

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Monomer?
correct: Small molecule that joins together to form a large polymer

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Acid?
correct: A substance that dissociates/ ionises in water to give H+ ions

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Salt?
correct: A hydrogen ion of (specific acid used) is replaced by (specific cation used)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Alkali?
correct: A substance that dissociates/ ionises in water to give OH- ions

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Electrolysis?
correct: A process by which a substance is broken down into its components by electricity

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Electroplating?
correct: The process of depositing a layer of metal on another substance

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Simple Cell?
correct: A device which converts chemical energy to electrical energy

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Fuel Cell?
correct: A device that converts the chemical energy from a fuel into electricity through a chemical reaction with oxygen or another oxidising agent

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Catalyst?
correct: A substance that speeds up a chemical reaction by providing an alternative reaction path with a lower activation energy, and remains chemically unchanged at the end of the reaction

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Exothermic reaction?
correct: Reactions that give out heat energy to the surroundings

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Endothermic reaction?
correct: Reactions that absorb out heat energy from the surroundings

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Activation Energy?
correct: Minimum energy required to be possessed by the reactant particles in order for a chemical reaction to occur

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Manufacturing Ammonia by Haber Process?
correct: 200 atm, 450°C, Iron catalyst

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Hydrogenation?
correct: 200°C, Nickel Catalyst

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Hydration?
correct: 65 atm, 200°C, Concentrated Phosphoric acid as catalyst

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Cracking?
correct: 1000°C, Catalysts Sand (SiO2) and Clay

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Esterification?
correct: Reflux with concentrated Sulfuric acid as catalyst

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions and products of Fermentation of aqueous glucose/carbonates to form ethanol?
correct: Yeast Catalyst, without oxygen (could oxidise alcohol), at 37°C
Product 10-20% ethanol in water (Can put through fractional distillation) + CO2

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Addition Polymerisation?
correct: At high temperature (200°C) and pressure (1000atm)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for Condensation Polymerisation?
correct: None

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Conditions for rusting?
correct: Oxygen and water/water vapour

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Raw materials in the Iron Blast Furnace?
correct: Haematite, (90% Fe2O3), Coke (carbon), Limestone (CaCO3), Hot air

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Properties of Transition Metals?
correct: Variable Oxidation States
Form Coloured Compounds
Often able to act as Catalysts

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Alloy?
correct: A mixture of metal and another element

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is/are Greenhouse gases?
correct: Gases which trap the infrared radiation from the sun are called greenhouse gases
